steps.content: Drop a dad joke in your caption to crack up your followers. If youâ€™re known to throw out a cheesy line from time to time, using a dad joke as your caption is a natural choice. steps.title: Try to craft a caption thatâ€™s short, silly, and snappy.
steps.content: Try to craft a caption thatâ€™s short, silly, and snappy. According to Dunn, your caption should be concise to â€œcaptivate the audience in the first eight secondsâ€ of seeing your post. After a few lines of text, Instagram hides the rest of your caption, so include the most eye-catching (or out of pocket) details at the beginning. Most users wonâ€™t read a lengthy caption, so when in doubt, keep it simple. Have fun experimenting with emojis to add more personality and character! Include questions in your caption to increase engagement . For instance, you could caption your post with â€œDoes this shirt make me look frat?â€ or â€œWho wants a kiss under the mistletoe?â€ Gasper also recommends â€œseeing whatâ€™s trending in pop culture and utilizing it in your post.â€ If thereâ€™s a viral song or meme, for example, you could reference it in your caption. Gasper also recommends â€œcoming up with five or six different captionsâ€ and choosing the best one. If youâ€™re not sure about which one to use, reach out to a friend or family member and ask for their opinion.
